main event: A rapid, small, and bright moving object was observed for 10 seconds in Logansville, Ohio on October 31, 1953.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be moving at a speed of 400 mph.
The object appeared to be oval-shaped and luminous, with a glow 'like a lot of electric light bulbs'.
The object made a sudden turn from east to west before disappearing from sight.
The witness, a 45-year-old farmer, observed the object through binoculars.
The witness compared the appearance of the object to 'a Margie rolled up glass jug about half as big again as the object.'
sighted object: A rapid, oval-shaped and luminous object
